content.raw: I didn't read that as you're wrong, the lidar mount is the [head link](#!/osrf/drcsim/src/3e342da8b0fab8c1a320c32d3afbec27ead38f88/models/drc_robot/model.urdf?at=multisense_no_vrc#cl-7), and if you count both the [neck_ay joint](#!/osrf/drcsim/src/3e342da8b0fab8c1a320c32d3afbec27ead38f88/models/drc_robot/model.urdf?at=multisense_no_vrc#cl-761) and the [hokuyo joint](#!/osrf/drcsim/src/3e342da8b0fab8c1a320c32d3afbec27ead38f88/models/drc_robot/model.urdf?at=multisense_no_vrc#cl-63) then all is well :)
content.html: I didn't read that as you're wrong, the lidar mount is the head link, and if you count both the neck_ay joint and the hokuyo joint then all is well :)

content.raw:
Hi Maurice,

The "nodding" joint is the `neck.ay` joint.

Note though the head appears to be "floating" for now, the offsets are correct, but the `utorso` link has not been updated to the new structure so it connects with the sensor joint location.  There will be mesh updates as soon as the new structure CAD/mesh is available.

John
content.html:
Hi Maurice,

The "nodding" joint is the neck.ay joint.

Note though the head appears to be "floating" for now, the offsets are correct, but the utorso link has not been updated to the new structure so it connects with the sensor joint location. There will be mesh updates as soon as the new structure CAD/mesh is available.

John

pullrequest.title: updating head to initial MultiSense SL model, with temporary unsynchronized streams.

content.raw:
I think you're missing a link on the laser - it should be head -> nodding_link -> head_hokuyo
The point of that extra link is that it densifies the laser point cloud even when the robot is standing perfectly stationary.

Question T172 from DARPA: 
How many degrees of freedom does the LIDAR mount have? 	
A. Two ‐a nodding 'yes' motion up and down, and a rotational DOF above the nodding joint about the head's x‐axis (forward facing axis).
content.html:
I think you're missing a link on the laser - it should be head -> nodding_link -> head_hokuyo The point of that extra link is that it densifies the laser point cloud even when the robot is standing perfectly stationary.

Question T172 from DARPA: How many degrees of freedom does the LIDAR mount have?
A. Two ‐a nodding 'yes' motion up and down, and a rotational DOF above the nodding joint about the head's x‐axis (forward facing axis).
